data.title: William Faulkner – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about William Faulkner. Browse William Faulkner’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
Absalom, Absalom!

By: William Faulkner

Narrated by: Grover Gardner

Length: 12 hrs and 31 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 930

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 767

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 768

Absalom, Absalom! tells the story of Thomas Sutpen, the enigmatic stranger who came to Jefferson township in the early 1830s. With a French architect and a band of wild Haitians, he wrung a fabulous plantation out of the muddy bottoms of the north Mississippi wilderness....

5 out of 5 stars

A long, enjoyable listen

The Hamlet, the first novel of Faulkner's Snopes trilogy, is both an ironic take on classical tragedy and a mordant commentary on the grand pretensions of the antebellum South....

By: William Faulkner

One of William Faulkner’s finest novels, As I Lay Dying, originally published in 1930, remains a captivating and stylistically innovative work. The story revolves around a grim yet darkly humorous pilgrimage, as Addie Bundren’s family sets out to fulfill her last wish....

5 out of 5 stars

Faulkner's As I Lay Dying review

By Kristina on 11-12-08

Faulkner’s second novel follows a bohemian cast of artists, socialites, and dilettantes as they set sail on a four-day excursion. Faulkner’s quick wit and endless appetite for satire make this a fascinating exploration of character, as well as a rare glimpse into the author himself....

3 out of 5 stars
